column2: Great place with delicious coffee and a super cute and warm ambiance! Baristas are welcoming and know what they're doing with their latte! Try their special Shortstack drink, it's so unique (custom recipe by them) and tasty!!
Really comfortable coffee shop with great espresso drinks and nice social setting. Ambience is perfect to meetup with someone for coffee. Not really a working place.
Coffee smells great! Eating a ginger muffin in a cozy space will make you happy.

Visited upon the recommendation of a family member and found it a gem of a coffeeshop. On top of the excellent sourcing/brewing of the coffee and the quite flavorful pastry, what really got me was the high level of service.  For example, on top of the normal pleasantries I was given a time expectation for my pour-over and a small cup of drip to ease the wait.  Will definitely be back whenever I’m in the city.
Super cute ambiance but the espresso isn’t how I like. It has a sharp bitter flavor and I prefer a smoother taste

Phenomenal multi-roaster shop in all measures. Neighborhood charm with a modern but cozy and interesting aesthetic (ie, feels good to hang out - the local neighbors are!), great selection of top local coffee, and maybe most importantly staffers who are nice and have the skill and knowledge to prepare their product. They get the most of the beans, which I appreciate hugely!
Neighborly chic vibe, great coffee, scrumptious pastries, see you next time.

1st visit, best coffee in recent memory. Ethiopian Gelgelu pour over. Sweet citrusy aroma, taste matched (rare for me with coffee, wine..). Matcha scone was amazing, not too sweet. Love the fitout & atmosphere - lacquered raw wood seats, bench. 🌈 Polaroid inspired colors. Friendly staff. No WiFi. …

I was going to write a long review about how awesome it is to have a truly neighborhood cafe where you run into friends and chat in line with strangers, but I just discovered their greatest secret attribute: Pinhole gives you a free taster of coffee to sip on while you wait for your pourover. Can life get better? I submit it cannot.

I’m breastfeeding so I can’t have much caffeine, but they have a decaf latte and it’s AMAZING. It’s a life saver for mommas with babies who miss coffee. Also there’s great service and a chill atmosphere, it’s a little full but everyone’s pretty respectful.
Delicious coffee and staff who knows how to use almond milk. Super cute and cozy atmosphere, love the live-wood coffee tables. Delicious mushroom & cheese croissants.

So lucky to have Pinhole in the neighborhood! I’ve worked in specialty coffee for a decade and their quality is consistently some of the best in the city. Great baristas, lovely parklet, nice people watching! On top of that, I appreciate how the owner JoEllen goes out of her way to make people feel welcome and appreciated. Worth going out of your way to check it out!
Cozy little coffee shop in Bernal Heights. Perfect place hangout with friends.The coffee is amazing and the baked goods are yumm. Be prepared for some line early morning.
Love the decor. Got a latte with whole milk and it was properly pulled. No bitterness at all, as it should be.
Well crafted third wave coffee with outdoor seating.

Love Pinhole coffee amazing cortado and everyone there was so nice went with my 4 year old son and the staff offered him a kiduccino. I had never heard of that and he LOVED it.  Thank you Pinhole crew!!!!
Good coffee and warm staff is a winning combination

A nice, small coffee place with friendly and smiling staff and very nice atmosphere. I ordered Matcha latte and a muchi chocolate donate which were ok. Small disadvantages, to my opinion, are lack of wifi and not enough seating places.

Excellent chai latte, teas, and pastries, all served with care by friendly staff in/on interesting locally made pottery. The cafe has an interesting inviting atmosphere that's miles away from a Starbucks. Despite the lack of wifi, I've decide this is the best cafe in Bernal Heights.

One of the best coffee places I've been in San Francisco. The coffee has amazing quality and it is made with love. The mix of wooden and metal decoration make it modern and inviting. Definitely a must visit!
Lovely artsy coffee shop where you can hang out or have your own corner. It’s always a good day at Pinhole Coffee!

I'm staying in the neighborhood for a week and this became my daily fix immediately.  It's tiny, with simple coffee choices and a few tasty bakery items. Don't go expecting a full blown breakfast menu and fancy, sweet drinks like those chains.  But go. And expect wonderful, smooth coffee, prepared exactly as it should be. I could drink their cappuccinos all day if it wouldn't give me a heart attack.

Iced Black coffee = $3.80 with your own cup discount! Great smooth feel, a little fruity/bittersweet for my taste preferences but still great. And can’t beat the beautiful interior and sleepy-yet-inviting Bernal morning neighborhood vibes!
Amazing coffee, quirky interior and super COVID-friendly staff!
A very cute place with great coffee. The Mochi muffin is very good, and the everything-croissant too. A really nice spot to visit when taking a trip to Bernal hill.
Delicious pastries....awesome coffee...and the best staff! Combined with a community, chill space. Definitely a great find in Bernal Heights!
Great latte and bottomless coffee (for here) if your looking for a sit and work/read place.  Had a hard time finding an outlet where I was working, but forced me to read instead 😀 …
Fun, stylish little place in Bernal - love the cute ceramic mugs. Had an amazing mochi muffin and delicious cappuccino. Great for catching up with friends or reading at the window bar.
Loved the piccolo latte and the affogato!

Friendly staff, hole-in-the-wall location, unique decor, is all let down by barely drinkable coffee. A large $6 mocha is a 12oz, I'd hate to see what the small was, and that tastes like any generic coffee and a iced latte that was basically just a iced milk.. Half way through and there was no reason to finish as it was just milk.

Sorry the mocha wasn't up to your standards Neil. Our 8oz size is $4.75 and our 12oz size is $5.25. We use a 64% Guittard chocolate chip that we melt down. It's not as sweet as some other places as we find it's easier to add sweetness rather than take it out (sugar at the condiment bar). We pull double ristretto espresso, a short but concentrated shot of espresso which should cut our milk fairly well. In the end, we take pride in our product and the r&d we've done for our items. Totally understand it won't please the diverse amount of tasting palates in the world, but we are satisfied. I hope you have your own cafe that you enjoy on a daily basis :)
A lovely neighborhood coffee shop . Great coffee and friendly staff. No access to WiFi though. Bring your books with you !

I finished my pour over several hours ago but I'm still thinking about it. I had a fantastic cup of coffee this morning at Pinhole. So good that in going to come back to try to buy those coffee beans for my at-home brewing. I really enjoyed the coffee I ordered.  Also a cool little shop. They have a parklet outside that you can enjoy your drink (currently not allowing people to consume inside).

This is my favorite coffee shop in SF. Their drinks are phenomenal but also the staff is so down to earth and lovely. They now have a parklet where people gather and chat. A welcoming and wonderful spot hidden up in Bernal.

Pinhole Coffee is hands down my favorite spot in the city. I lived down the street pre pandemic and looked forward to seeing the staff and enjoying an excellent espresso and pastry.  If you're in the area, or not, I can't recommend Pinhole enough. Warm vibes, friendly staff and great coffee.

My favorite coffee shop!!! Started going before the pandemic when I moved to the neighborhood in 2019, and the staff, coffee, and community of customers were so great I just kept hanging out there. Throughout the pandemic JoEllen has always put the safety of her staff and community first, you can tell she really cares. And through all of that the cafe feels tapped in to which small roasters are putting out great beans, and does justice to them with great barista-ing. I recommend Pinhole to everyone. 💜💜💜

This place is a gem. After working in coffee for 10+ years- I have seen some things! And Pinhole is one of my favorite spots in the City. Their espresso is excellent, and they put a lot of care into dialing in their shots every day. Milk textures by drink type are always on point. They have creative local pastries- and let’s not forget they were a lot of people’s first taste of Midnight Bagels! I also want to specifically call out their house Masarap beans- sooo good for brewing at home. Last but not least, in a sea of coffee shops that are basically coworking spaces- they blissfully don’t offer wifi. Instead, at Pinhole you get art, neighbors mingling, and the most wonderful feeling of an actual community gathering spot. It’s the real deal.

I really just did not get this obvious local favorite.  They only allow one person to enter at a time due to COVID. One person and your dog, if you have one. They had a tea selection and my friend enjoyed his coffee. They had some cookies but not really any additional food items. The staff wasn't particularly polite or impolite, more just caught up in whatever was going on with themselves.  I sat out front for about 2 hours chatting with my buddy, and the place does business. Again, all locals. I think they go there because there's not much other competition in walking distance.
Excellent coffee selection, very friendly staff, and good pastries. Dry the pour over, worth the wait.
Literally the best coffee and most skilled baristas in Bernal Heights

I’ve lived in SF for over a decade and have been to pretty much every coffee shop you could name and this is by far one of the best. So many of the even reputable coffee shops in the city you never know what you’re gonna get in terms of quality, but I have never had a bad latte here.

Oat milk wasn't great, customer service was alright, but they didn't allow time to look at their specialty items due to trying to get people in& out. Almost bought a bag o' beans. 🤷🏻‍♂️  Edit: To the Pinhole Coffee owner: I did not perceive anything in any other way than what it was. Thank you for patronizing my experience, will not be coming back. For the future, and for the sake of other customers, maybe have your crew ask if customers would like to have a look around before shoo'ing them out. Consider changing your oat-milk, too. Best wishes.  Edit pt 2: owner deleted their comment. they pretty much tried to gas-light me. all good though, found new favorites. 🤙🏽

Jonathan, my response is still here. Glad you found something that makes you happy :)  Hi Jonathan. Sorry you perceived us as rushing you. That isn’t our intention. We appreciate people supporting our small business beyond drinks. Take your time next time, you can ask us for help too!  We love the oat milk we use. Pacific Oat Barista Series was designed by the people that use it the most, Baristas. It also has less sugar than some of it's competitors. Sorry to have lost you, truly hope you found a place that fulfills your day :)

Unkind people working  12/12/21 Improving my review to make it more constructive— Seems like this place has a lot of loyal customers. As a previous patron wrote, for COVID they let one party in at a time (which I can understand) so there is a pretty long (and slow moving) line. I guess the bummer is that when you get in there the staff is sort of impolite and short and I perceived that they felt it was a chore that they had to attend to customers. My suggestion would be to focus a little more on basic customer service— eye contact, greeting with smile, etc :) Good coffee. Thank you!

Hi Morgan, Sorry for your experience. Feel free to message me any specifics as I like to talk it out with my crew to be proactive towards our intention of quality and hospitality. The holidays can be tough, and even more so in a pandemic. For anyone it’s a good reminder to regroup/balance in stressful times. Appreciate the support for our pinhole sized business.  joellen@pinholecoffee.com

Nice cafe with relaxing atmosphere and friendly people. I have ordered Cortado and it taste very good, I would give them 5 star if the coffee was a bit stronger and less milky. They also have some pastries and tea options in the menu. Highly recommended and would come back
Good coffee, mochi donuts and ginger scone. Chai was a bit watery.

Awesome cappuccino and really good croissants here. Staff is friendly and the place has a small-town feel for a big city, which is nice. Prices are moderate to high, but if you want good coffee in SF, you can't be cheap!
Pinhole is my go-to for coffee!! 🥰 Their coffee (beans and drinks) is incredible. Everyone is so friendly and knowledgeable. And my kiddos and I live in their merch. We can’t get enough!
Went to this cafe seeing the great reviews.The decor is cute, coffee average  and  the staff very curt and grumpy.

Hi Harsha. Sorry this was your experience, and I’m hoping it was an off human day for whoever you were experiencing this grumpiness with (never know what someone is going through). Overall, the community constantly reminds us of how friendly, present and informational the Pinhole Crew is. I’ll continue to remind the crew of sustaining hospitality at our small business.

This corner of the Earth is special. Is it the coffee? Is it the people? Is it the art? Is it the Muni tokens on the beautiful tile floor?  It’s all that and thensome. I like my coffee tall dark and handsome.  Love to the whole pinhole crew.  Act like you knew.  Besos y abrazos

LOVE this place. Definitely the best coffee shop in the Bernal Heights area. I'm usually obsessed with unique flavored lattes but Pinhole's unflavored, unsweetened latte hits the spot despite that. Also super covid friendly.
Coffee is good, staff is friendly, and it's a great place to meet the neighborhood! They have pastries of all sorts from Kahnfections and Wholesome Bakery.

Very thoughtful and cute queer woman (qwoc owned) coffee shop with delicious baked goods. Really sweet lowkey neighborhood feel with a fun energetic vibe. The drinks are great (the matcha and coffee are top tier), the owner is rly cool and very into the local small business community in bernal. And right near historic lesbian bar Wild Side West. A great shop with an important place in the bernal/sf community- you have to see it!
Excellent coffee, friendly and skilled baristas giving great service - a micro-community in a special neighborhood.
Love Pinhole coffee and vibe - it’s made our five years in Bernal feel like home. I also think the coffee is better than Sightglass or Ritual - it’s stronger and nuttier (they use Linea).

This cafe is SUPER cute, with lots of wooden decor (including tree stump tables), and bright colors on the walls. Friendly to both kids and dogs, their coffee selection was big enough to find your favorite drink, and definitely classy. My Columbian pour-over and my boyfriend's decaf cappuccino were both delicious! The baristas were very friendly, as well. 10/10 would recommend.
What a perfect cup of coffee!

GREAT customer service. Joseph is the best! Definitely try their Sweet cream affogato! They serve their coffee in beakers. Cute little place in Ktown. The boyfriend and I haven't had one complaint about this place! Tonight we tried their Testing - mad for caffeine which is their coffee sampler! They offer $1 validation. Parking is tight. We walked here. They have free wifi. They have a lot of seating, chairs sofa and stools. Clean restroom.

Thanks for the positive review BUT this is not for our cafe, Pinhole Coffee. No one works here named Joseph and we don’t have sweet cream affogato (we do have a yummy madagascar vanilla Gelato based affogato). We are in Bernal Heights in SF and not KTown.
Best coffee shop in San Francisco! They make you feel part of a community here.
Fun, colorful, clean coffee place. Bit busy, but service very fast and friendly. Coffee quite good, baked goods excellent too. Fun apparel, and kid friendly. Kidduccino.. haha..
Super cute, friendly coffee shop. Great tasting coffee, I don't even need to sweeten my latte. Women owned business and super covid conscious and safe.

Such a genuine coffee experience! We got the matcha latte (with oat milk) and a mocha (whole milk) and both were rich and creamy, perfect temperature too. The mocha wasn't super sweet and the matcha had that kind of bitter flavor at the end.  The staff were all welcoming and you could tell they love their customers. It's not a very big Cafe so I could see seating getting taken up quick during busy hours. Great Cafe for littles--lots of toys and what not.
Disappointed with both the cappuccino and the cortado. I don’t know why but the espresso tastes burnt and dusty. Extremely cute shop decor though I guess

Thanks for messaging us Olivia. Our house espresso is a medium roast. In addition, we always offer a light roast single origin w/ a rotating guest roaster. Sorry our product wasn’t to your liking. I’ll touch base with our quality control team to make sure everything is aligned to what our standard is. Thanks for kinda liking our decor.
Great place full of locals. Excellent coffee. Yummy pastries.

Super popular neighborhood coffeeshop. Every weekend there's a line around the corner. They're very orderly with their queue and ordering/checkout. If the line is really long sometimes they have someone come out to take orders and pre-prep the drinks so it's ready quickly. I usually get a regular latte, but an occasional matcha affogato is a great treat.
Cute coffee shop that also sells t-shirts and gifts. There are few seats outside and a great sandviches next door. Great for a pick at the park a block away.

Coffee is very good, the owner and her family? And staff were all extremely nice. This is a very home..y feeling place where the locals in the neighborhood seem to go. I'll definitely stop back by in my next trip to town.
Sweetest little cafe with great espresso drinks and tasty treats. There’s a reason this spot is so beloved by the neighborhood!!
Amazing cappuccinos in a lovely spot welcome to everyone.

It's a cool neighborhood coffee shop. Great ambience, nice baristas, and pretty good coffee. I also appreciate their off-the-beaten-path pastries collection. The last time I was there I had a pretty tasty ube (purple yam; it's kinda like taro) custard cake.
Extremely cute coffee place with very nice people working there.
Good coffee, cold, curt, rude staff. Bummer.

Been here a few times but their coffee, espresso and pastries were hella good and flavorful everytime. Went in today to get some coffee to take home, and even if it was quite busy everyone was nice (as always) and killin it behind the bar. Overall, this is a great place to hit up.
Best coffee in Bernal, and good small breakfast options.
My favorite coffee shop in the city; we come here every time we are in town. Great coffee and pastries, super friendly neighborhood vibe.  The perfect place to start the day.
Lovely coffee spot!!

Very cute cafe. The staff was very inviting. It's good if you want to unplug especially or catch up with a friend. There is no internet or readily available plugs so if you want to work you might consider somewhere else.

Best coffee shop in SF. The staff is friendly and helpful. Most of the baristas can even make latte art in almond milk and it's never burnt. The chocolate for mochas is actually a melted chocolate product not some crummy powdered substance. Super kid friendly too if you have little ones. And they have dog treats for your four-legged friends - and a water dish outside as well. Still amazing coffee shop, that now carries Pacific barista oat milk.
Fantastic espresso, knowledgeable and friendly staff, good selection of beans! Love it!
Decent coffee for a neighborhood place. Not on the same level as local roasteries like Andytown or Sightglass (I think they stock Verve or similar here). Always polite, quick service.

Thanks for stopping by our cafe Caly. We serve fresh (but properly rested) coffee by local roaster Linea Caffe. The Pinhole Crew is dedicated to dialing in our coffees daily, and I’m grateful for the level our team puts out. It’s amazing to have a variety of coffee shops out there to meet the needs of different palates✌🏽
Great coffee, awesome staff, and fun little shop. You won't be disappointed. I live about 10 min away and I make this a frequent stop when I need a good latte or drip.

Hands down pinhole coffee has the best pick me ups in Bernal Heights, as well as some of the best pastries. The cappuccinos are IMHO without local comparison.  Full disclosure (I have a small crush on the owner/espresso wizard) and I used to be a die hard Sand Box cafe fanboy until they sold out to Pinkies.  I still love the original owners pastries when she occasionally shows up with some of her finest.  Great success to Pinhole!

Excellent local coffee shop. I'm super picky about coffee and I'm thrilled that this place is nearby. Their baristas are unpretentious and talented, and their rotating selection of roasts for pour-over is seriously on point.

Another gem in the Bernal neighborhood. If you appreciate a good pour over coffee, you must go here. When I moved first to SF, many folks pointed me to Blue Bottle, Philz, etc but I never really enjoyed them. You gotta find these small little gems who are taking the coffee game to the next level but at the same time feel very neighborhoody. Don’t forget to ask for the punch card as their coffee is seriously addictive.

Cute coffee shop in Bernal! It was pretty late in the afternoon when I went, so I ended up getting tea. They serve teas from Red Blossom Tea Company, and I ended up getting the Elderflower tea, which was refreshing and delicious. The baristas there are super friendly, and it seems like a great neighborhood spot where people stop by for a quick cup of joe or to catch up.
It was an ok come thru...ended up at a joint down the street.  Lines were to long /  UPDATE FROM RESPONSE: yea no worries, the other place was awesome.  We'll just go there next time also. 👍

We are grateful for the community support. We are also grateful to figure out proper social distancing and are only allowing one customer in at a time. Sorry it didn't work out for you and you didn't get to truly experience us or our product. Cheers.
Good coffee in the Bernal Heights area that is really good for kids. Small space but good coffee. If you are lucky enough to get parking on Cortland, you win life.
My favorite coffee shop in SF.
Good coffee nice people!
Really nice coffee and friendly staff, although there could be a more extensive range of food. The blueberry and oat muffins were both lovely and moist.
Pinhole really just blesses ole Bernal with fantastic coffee, fun staff and yummy pastries when you want an extra treat. Get the mochi muffin!
Excellent cafe that makes excellent espresso and supports the LGBTQ community. If you want something a bit different and stronger, get the Picollo! It's basically a Gibraltar/Cortado.
Wish there were more seating but otherwise it's a lovely coffee spot. Ambience is cozy and filled with natural light. Drinks are consistently well made.
Cute coffee shop on cute street. Had a great latte as well, with plenty of snacks. Fun neighborhood spot.
Nice cozy place to grab a coffee with friends. There is a nice butcher shop next door too that reminds me of old local meat shops! Worth the try for sure.
Great coffee, my favorite in the Bay Area so far!
Great local neighborhood coffee shop!
Recently moved to the neighborhood and definitely making this my go-to place! Coffee was great and the barista had a great attitude and attention to all the people coming in.
Nice place with great lattes. The only thing I don’t like there - they don’t have an oven or microwave to warm up great tasty pastries they serve.
Great coffee and pastries. Small coffee shop with a relaxed vibe, kid friendly and really cool decoration. Go with your kids to holly park and the have a cappuccino here ;)
Good coffee drinks, a smallish selection of pastry type things that are fairly decent.  Very friendly vibe, but if you aren't up for family friendly may not be your speed.

I want to give this place 5 stars, it is a really great atmosphere and the tea is tasty. Unfortunately they don't have WiFi for customers. This is a showstopper for a coffee shop, especially in San Francisco.

Hey Adam, Thanks for stopping by and enjoying our environment. I wanted to express our intentions for no wifi. We find that more people connect with each other physically when we don't have it. It's amazing to see neighbors actually interacting with each other and becoming long term friends. It isn't the "norm" now in society but we wanted a chance for people to have a break from their screens. At least there's a lot of places out there for wifi, our favorite is the Bernal Public Library. Even Bernal Bubbles has wifi. Have a good day 🙏🏽
Cute place, good coffee, nice staff!
This is a wonderful neighborhood cafe. They use Verve coffee for their espresso which I love! And there staff is super sweet.
Great Service and taste.
Good coffee (decaf oat latte), quaint location, on calm Street, with some outdoor bench seating.
A friendly neighborhood cafe, with great coffee and yummy pastries.
Order a piccolo here, it's small, strong, and very delicious!
Great coffee in the neighborhood.  Surprisingly fast service considering a daunting line.
Hey, pinhole guys, you start people’s day. Please, be nice to people.

Hi Anna. Thanks for supporting our small business. Kindness is a goal we try to have with each interaction. Sorry if it didn’t come off that way in your last transaction. I checked in with my staff this AM to see if there were any issues today and they said so far they’ve been having a pleasant day. If there’s a certain situation that happened please email me at joellen[@]pinholecoffee.com so I can nip it in the bud. Overall, I’m very grateful for the customer service from the Pinhole Crew. I understand it’s not perfect all the time, and that’s when we try to talk it out with each other. Have a great day!
Such a cute little spot!

Gaack!!!  Not open when they say they are.  So, for example, if you're walking up the hill on a Monday morning, at like, 8:30 AM, and need a place with a cup of coffee, and a bathroom, you're out of luck.  Other than that, it looked great inside... you know... through the locked door.

Hi Hamilton. We are closed today due to an emergency with our AM staff. Hope you can understand. Sorry for the inconvenience.  Update: We re-opened today at noon. Us being closed beyond posted hours does not happen often. This morning we dealt with a situation beyond our control.
Cutest, cozy coffee spot on Cortland Ave. Grab a coffee and a pastry on your walk up to Bernal Hill. Friendly staff, and everything is very tasty.
JoEllen has a gem of a coffee shop, snuggle in Bernal Heights!  Coffee was Made By Humans with an artisanal touch. Great space, great vibe, great space! I will be back!
Consistently amazing. Best coffee shop in the area!
Some of the best tea ive had
Probably the best coffee in the city :) Super cute, friendly place, too. Only downside is no Wi-Fi.
This place must be quite good because there was quite a line of people waiting outside for their fix of caffeine. I didn't have the patience to wait in line so I just went elsewhere...

Thanks Christine. I hope you can stop by sometime. We have a system after 8:30a where someone from the Pinhole Crew comes out to take orders, that way the staff inside can get the line moving efficiently :)
The best coffee in Bernal! Nice little parklet outside to enjoy your coffee
Great espresso and pour overs
Delicately made coffee and tea.  No Wi-Fi though.
Cool place...  solid coffee, especially pour overs.  No wifi provided, which changes the crowd a bit, and I like it
Enjoyed the sparkling iced americano
you will get sass if you ask about wifi. good thing there are 2+ other cafes nearby for working! lovely decor though

Hi Patrick. Sorry if you felt like you got attitude when you asked about Wifi, if you let me know the time and day you were there I can talk to the staff that was on shift at the time. Our mission at Pinhole Coffee is to “serve a quality product in a hospitable way that enriches the community.” For us, not having WiFi enriches the community, it allows a different type of connection to beings. Anywho, it is great that there are a lot of other options for WiFi around the neighborhood...we personally love the Public Library nearby. Have a good day :)
Great vibe. Family friendly. Great coffee, but not very many things to eat.
Super cool coffee spot.
Nice place, good coffee, great staff, but it was a little small not enough room to hangout

Parallel to our name “Pinhole” 😉 We wish we had a bigger space sometimes, but we are grateful for what we were able to find and what could be produced in such a small space. Thanks for coming in Sarah 🙏🏽
Perfectly balanced cortado (right roast, right pull, right steamed milk), great servers and a cool location (check out the stump stools!).
Great coffee, awesome owner, yummy pastries. This is a beloved neighborhood business
Several great gluten-free treats in a fun scene! Try the almond tea cake if you can
Good coffee, but small cups with crappy ecofriendly lids that always spill. Not worth the mess.
True community coffee shop. Locals welcome, but others like myself are also given a spot to chill and relax.
Best coffee on Bernal. Super friendly staff and photo themed!
The best cafe in SF! Amazing coffee, treats, and community
The coffee is good, the space is cosy, good music plays and interesting and there is a selection of tempting baked goods. What else do you want?
Incredible coffee, awesome baristas, and great atmosphere. Wonderful community spot.
Nice, cosy neighbourhood coffee shop. Staff were friendly. Prices were reasonable too.
What a wonderful discovery! Amazing coffee, and a stellar staff. Thank you for your kindness ❤️☕
Lots of character, lots of light and family friendly atmosphere. good place to get your caffeine fix
Delicious espresso drinks and pour over coffee and a very friendly staff.
Good coffee, out of the way and cute.
Blessed real space. Have fond memories of the funky coffee shop that was the earlier iteration. I approve. ❤️
Nice atmosphere, yummy coffee and pastries, and even magnetic letters on a big metal wall for the kids.
Delicious coffee and an extremely interesting interior. Custom woodworking makes this place really stand out.
Love this establishment. Great coffee and staff
Really great coffee shop! The baristas are very helpful and attentive.
Lovely varieties of loose tea with free refills and a pleasant ambience with many small children and families present.
Lovely local gem.  A nice spot to hang out to have a cup of coffee with your friends.
Great coffee. Great service. Great atmosphere. Highly recommend.
Really good coffee. Not a place to work/study as they do not have comfortable chair or WiFi
Great place to grab a coffee and they have a delicious fruit Danish croissant.
This place is a very nice place I was very much elated to have patronized them I can absolutely refer a couple of friends here It’s a lovely place to be
Got a perfect cappuccino here. Friendly staff and laid-back, welcoming vibes.
Bought some expensive coffee that is not as interesting as I would have hoped.

Sorry you didn’t enjoy our beans. If you want to give it a try, when we dial in our coffees we play around with our grind every day. Sometimes coarsening it, opens the coffees up more. If it already tastes watery to you, fining it up as it ages especially helps. Sometimes we play with dose too. Good luck.
Not bad cold brew. Would be better in plastic cups. Great atmosphere for lounging.

Thanks for stopping by and your feedback. We hope to eventually carry compostable iced drink cups, but at the moment it is too pricey to do so and iced drinks are just a small percentage of drinks we serve. Please feel free to stay and drink coffee at our shop, it's even more tastier in glass!
Great local coffee shop, very kid friendly and walking distance to the park.
Some of the best coffee in the neighborhood and delicious mochi pastries.
My favorite coffee place. I had the same coffee at other places and it is not as good as Pinhole.
Great spot to chill and hang out.  Great Linea coffees.  Wow.  A+!
I love pinhole. The coffee is delicious and the owner is so kind and talkative.
Great coffee and really friendly employees. My go-to java joint.
Fun cafe with delicious coffee and pastries, located in a cute neighborhood.
Great coffee and a small selection of tasty pastries.
I loved their savory pastry!
Great coffee and pastries. Love the vibe of this neighborhood coffee shop.
Excellent coffee and pastries, homey atmosphere and cool design.

Good mocha, but pretty bad setup for working. No wifi or outlets.

Thanks Teresa for coming in and liking our mocha. It is with our intention that we don't offer wifi and outlets, we hope this could be a place where people can unplug and connect in other ways with people or with self. Cortland Ave. is amazing though where there are options for your intentions, Progressive Grounds and the Public Library is where I go where I need to get work done involving the screen. Have a great day.

We will reopen our space when we’re comfortable to. There is currently a spike on Covid cases right now and we want to take proper precautions for the Pinhole Crew who is in the space 5+ hours. Enjoy the beauty of sipping coffee in our parklet or all the special nooks in Bernal Heights. I know there are some cafes that have indoor seating as well that you can support.
